# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/platformdirs/__main__.py
@source-hash: 8c127ccdbecca71e
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:01:29Z

## Purpose
Command-line demonstration script for the platformdirs library, showcasing cross-platform directory path resolution for application data storage.

## Key Components

### Constants
- `PROPS` (L7-23): Tuple defining all supported platform directory properties including user directories (data, config, cache, state, log, documents, downloads, pictures, videos, music, runtime) and site directories (data, config, cache, runtime)

### Main Function
- `main()` (L26-51): Demonstration function that creates multiple PlatformDirs instances with different configurations:
  - With version parameter (L34)
  - Without version parameter (L39) 
  - Without app author (L44)
  - With disabled app author (L49)
- Iterates through all PROPS to display resolved directory paths for each configuration

### Entry Point
- Standard `if __name__ == "__main__"` pattern (L54-55) for CLI execution

## Dependencies
- `PlatformDirs` class from parent package for directory resolution
- `__version__` for displaying library version information

## Architecture Notes
- Uses hardcoded demo values ("MyApp", "MyCompany") for illustration
- Demonstrates different PlatformDirs constructor signatures and their effects on path resolution
- Output formatted with version header and categorized sections
- All print statements include `# noqa: T201` comments to suppress linting warnings

## Usage Pattern
This is a diagnostic/demo script typically run via `python -m pip._vendor.platformdirs` to show platform-specific directory paths for different application configurations.
